```{r, include=FALSE}
mydf <- HelpMe:::read.file("dataquad.csv")
```

You need to have a file containing: driver, n columns performance and n columns impacts.
The name of the impacts columns will be used when running the quadmap
```{r}
mydf[c(9,10,18),c(1,2,3,9,10)] #extract table
```
# Simple Use

run_quadmap sets up the quadmaps that we need to export to PPTX.
If Officer and rvg are installed, you can use custom_pptx function
It saved all the quadmaps into one single pptx.


```{r}
plots <- HelpMe::run_quadmap("dataquad.csv")
if (HelpMe::check_pptx.CA()) {
  mypptx <- custom_pptx(plots, use_template = FALSE)
  print(mypptx, "example.pptx")
}
```
